results.title: Sink or swim
results.creator_credit: Gwynneth Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Gwynneth Cole joined the army in 1944, roles for women were limited. While Cole didn’t get to serve on the front line, she was posted to different bases in Australia as a nurse and faced many hardships and the realities of war. Cole greatly values her time in the army and reflects on the opportunities for women and the independent streak she has passed on to her four daughters.

results.title: Singapore dollars
results.creator_credit: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edward Dunstan served in the Australian Navy for 20 years, spending a significant part of that time in Singapore. While he enjoyed his time there, Dunstan also has some bad memories, not least of all was how he was received by his fellow Australians on his return. However, these experiences have encouraged him to help others through his work at the RSL.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Big, grey and tubey
results.creator_credit: Sage Armstrong, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When the tornado hit, Sage Armstrong and her mother took shelter in the toilet. Traumatised by the experience, Armstrong was able to find solace in helping others in the aftermath.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: What else matters?
results.creator_credit: Maree Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Maree Somerville acknowledges that, despite the devastation, the day could’ve had a different ending - one more tragic. For Somerville, it has been an opportunity to recognise what really matters in life.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Storm at sea, tornado on land
results.creator_credit: Kelly Lennon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
As Kelly Lennon ate breakfast, she knew it was going to be a miserable day. What followed was so terrifying that it was only when her mother returned that she felt safe.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Friendship beats the storm
results.creator_credit: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best friends Kiera Chapman and Eliza Goldsmith have been through quite a lot together. When Chapman’s family took shelter during the torando that hit Lennox Head in 2010, Goldsmith cut her feet running over to see if Chapman was ok. As they weathered the storm together, they share the experience with their family, community and with each other.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Force of the wind
results.creator_credit: Justin Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Justin Somerville never thought he would be in the middle of a tornado, so his first reaction was that he wanted to witness this phenomena. His account of the aftermath provides detail well beyond the media coverage of the devestation of this small town.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A Trail of destruction
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The whole thing probably lasted about twenty seconds, but for Jeremy Somerville, his family and community, it is an event they will never forget.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Under the stairs
results.creator_credit: Emily Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When Emily Somerville first heard the loud bangs in the morning, she thought it was her family making the noise. When she realised it was more serious than that, Somerville and her family took shelter under the stairs, surviving the tornado but finding it hard to control her emotions afterwards.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emily Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Big roar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Daniel Young didn’t feel safe the night before the tornado roared through his house. After it had passed, Young’s family were safe but it had left a great wave of destruction in its path.

On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
